byline.contributor: Erik Eckholm reported from Gretna, and Manny Fernandez from Houston. Ellen Ann Fentress contributed reporting from Jackson, Miss.
byline.original: By ERIK ECKHOLM and MANNY FERNANDEZ

abstract: States across the South begin offering marriage licenses to same-gender couples following Supreme Court ruling giving gay men and lesbians constitutional right to marry.
lead_paragraph: Louisiana and Mississippi officials, citing the rule of law, softened their defiance and began offering marriage licenses to gay and lesbian couples.

headline.main: After Same-Sex Marriage Ruling, Southern States Fall in Line
headline.print_headline: Falling in Line in the South With Ruling on Marriage

snippet: Louisiana and Mississippi officials, citing the rule of law, softened their defiance and began offering marriage licenses to gay and lesbian couples.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
